div1.p: I hope, sir, that this greeting catches you in sufficient good health and bouyant enough of spirit to do those things you must and yet able to do those things you will —
For myself, I think it immeasurable to ask more.
I find this view particularly apt as I approach the end of novel -- that literary equivalent of the magpie's art -- which I have been piecing together for the last five years.
Five years and the best of it is what I have learned, not what I have said.
If there is any merit in the book it will certainly be due in a great part to my sharing of your salt.

lg.l: Fly away, doves of El Valle,
